identity.tone: Tactical, Urgent, Precision, 'War Room' Command Center
identity.mission: Create a high-stakes, incident-response interface that feels like a military-grade tool, not a generic SaaS dashboard.
anti_patterns: No gradients on text unless for specific 'glitch' effects

headings.usage: Page titles, Metric values, Section headers

body.usage: General text, Form labels, Table data

mono.usage: Timers, Logs, IP addresses, Hash values, Code snippets

buttons.primary: bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700 text-white shadow-lg shadow-blue-900/20 rounded-md font-medium px-4 py-2 transition-all active:scale-95
buttons.danger: bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 text-white shadow-lg shadow-red-900/20 rounded-md font-medium animate-pulse-slow
buttons.outline: border border-gray-700 hover:bg-gray-800 text-gray-300 rounded-md bg-transparent

cards.base: bg-[#111827] border border-gray-800 rounded-lg shadow-sm hover:border-gray-700 transition-colors

inputs.base: bg-[#1F2937] border-gray-700 text-white focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-transparent placeholder:text-gray-500 rounded-md h-10 px-3

badges.success: bg-emerald-950/50 text-emerald-400 border border-emerald-900/50 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-xs font-semibold uppercase tracking-wider
badges.warning: bg-amber-950/50 text-amber-400 border border-amber-900/50 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-xs font-semibold uppercase tracking-wider
badges.danger: bg-red-950/50 text-red-400 border border-red-900/50 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-xs font-semibold uppercase tracking-wider
badges.neutral: bg-gray-800 text-gray-400 border border-gray-700 px-2 py-0.5 rounded text-xs font-semibold uppercase tracking-wider

tables.header: bg-gray-900/50 text-gray-400 text-xs uppercase tracking-wider font-semibold border-b border-gray-800 h-10 px-4 text-left

icons.usage: Use stroke-width={1.5} for a refined, technical look. Size usually 16-20px.

universal_guidelines: Always use a dark, high-contrast theme by default.
Interactive elements must have clear hover and active states.
Use monospace fonts for all numerical data, IDs, and timestamps.
Ensure the 'War Room' mode visually dominates the screen when active (Red borders/headers).
Do not use gradients for backgrounds unless it's a subtle glow.
Charts should use the specific semantic colors defined (Success/Warning/Danger).
instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Update tailwind.config.js to include the custom colors and fonts (Chivo, Inter, JetBrains Mono).
2. Install necessary fonts via Google Fonts in index.html or import in CSS.
3. Create a 'Layout' component that handles the Sidebar and Header structure.
4. Implement the 'War Room' context/store to toggle the global urgency state (Red Header).
5. Use Recharts for all data visualization (Attack Vector, stats).
6. Build the 'Timer' component using the Monospace font.
7. Ensure the 'Mailbox' looks like a real email client (Sidebar list + Main view).
8. Use the `data-testid` attribute on all buttons and inputs.
